Method description: Shoots with flower buds were collected every 200 chill units and buds were rated after 3 weeks at 24°C. Budbreak rated on scale of 1-7. Mean chilling requirements were calculated and used to determine number of chill units required for 50% budbreak.
Method reference: Rowland LJ, et al., Mol Breed. 2014;34(4):2033–48.

Method name: Percent of dead buds due to winter damage
Method description: Shoots from plants subjected to freeze-thaw protocol, distal buds assessed for damage and percent of damage calculated, measured as LT50 which is temperature that causes 50% injury overall.
Method reference: Rowland LJ, Ogden EL, Bassil N, Buck EJ, McCallum S, Graham J, et al. Construction of a genetic linkage map of an interspecific diploid blueberry population and identification of QTL for chilling requirement and cold hardiness. Mol Breed. 2014;34(4):2033–48.

Method name: Rating of berry resistance to SWD feeding
Method description: A resistance index was calculated as the sum of the number of fly reproductive parameters not significant (indicated by **) from the host (Vaccinium) standard)) + 1 (for significance from non-host standard) or +2 (for non-significance from non-host standard). The minimal resistance value is 1, the maximum is 5.
Method reference: Blair Sampson, and Stephen Stringer, Kim Hummer, Ebrahiem Babiker, Chris Werle, and Donna Marshall-Shaw 2020. (submitted for publication 2020)

Method description: Spotted-wing drosphila average larvae per fruit calculated
Method reference: Sampson et al. 2020 SWD antibiosis

Method name: Spotted-wing Drosophila resistance, oviposition success index scale
Method description: One hundred berries were sampled from each of the 88 rabbiteye and southern highbush cultivars and selections and examined for the presence or absence of SWD feeding damage or egg laying, translated to show non-preference or susceptibility based on counts.
Method reference: Stringer, S.J., Sampson, B.J. and Hummer, K.E. (2017). Screening small fruit germplasm for resistance to southern populations of invasive spotted wing drosophila, SWD (Diptera: Drosophilidae). Acta Hortic. (ISHS) 1180:45-52 https:

Category 1: 1.0=long harvest spread (80% harvested in greater than 10 days)
Category 2: 2.0=long harvest spread (70% harvested in greater than 10 days))
Category 3: 3.0=moderately long harvest spread (60% harvested in greater than 10 days))
Category 4: 4.0=above average harvest spread (50% harvested in greater than 10 days))
Category 5: 5.0=average harvest spread (40% harvested in greater than 10 days))
Category 6: 6.0=moderately short harvest spread (30% harvested in greater than 10 days)
Category 7: 7.0=short harvest spread level 7 (20% harvested in greater than 10 days)
Category 8: 8.0=short harvest spread level 7 (10% harvested in greater than 10 days)
Category 9: 9.0=short harvest spread (80% of berries harvested in less than 10 days)

Trait description: ELISA test results for Blueberry Shock Virus
Method description: Results of Blueberry shock virus tested by ELISA assay. Used in conjunction to derive Blueberry Shock Virus Years to Develop
Method reference: Finn, C.E., Mackey, T.A., Postman, J.D. and Martin, R.R. (2017). Identifying blueberry germplasm that is slow to get Blueberry shock virus in the Pacific Northwest United States. Acta Hortic. 1180, 423-430. DOI: 10.17660

Trait description: Number of years before the plant tests positive for Blueberry Shock Virus
Method description: Number of years since planting that the plant tests positive for Blueberry shock virus by ELISA assay. Lower values means that the plant succumbs to the virus faster; higher values means that the plant does not test positive for the virus for a longer time. Ultimately categorized into <3 years - rapid to test positive, 3-5 years intermediate to test positive, 5-10 slow to test positive, >10 very slow to test positive. Referenced in Finn, C.E., Mackey, T.A., Postman, J.D. and Martin, R.R. (2017). Identifying blueberry germplasm that is slow to get Blueberry shock virus in the Pacific Northwest United States.

Method name: Testing of leafhopper resistance in controlled conditions
Method description: Leafhopper growth index values were calculated. Highly susceptible had values close to 25 and resistant had an index value of zero.
Method reference: Meyer, J. R. and J. R. Ballington. 1990. Resistance of Vaccinium spp. to the leafhopper Scaphytopius magdalensis (Homoptera: Cicadellidae). Ann. Entomol. Soc. Am. 83: 515-520.

Trait description: Index calculated from vegetative vigor, yield, and nutrient deficiency
Method name: Plant growth and yield due to soil
Method description: A mineral soil adaptation index (0 – 10) for each genotype was calculated as follows: mineral soil adaptation score = Ʃ mean ratings for vegetative vigor, yield balance and nutrient deficiency symptoms divided by 5. This index was used in conjunction with growth and fruiting data to evaluate genotypic response to the mineral soil environment. Individuals displaying indices > or = 7.5 exhibited mineral soil adaptation. Referenced in Scheerens, J.C., Erb, W.A., Goulart, B.L., and Hancock, J.F. (1999a). Blueberry hybrids with complex genetic backgrounds evaluated on mineral soils: stature, growth rate, yield potential and adaptability to mineral soil conditions as influenced by parental species.
Method reference: Fruit Var. J. 53, 73–90.

Method reference: Smith, B.J. 2009. Botryosphaeria stem blight of southern blueberries: Cultivar susceptibility and effect of chemical treatments. Acta Hort.810:385–394

Trait description: Measurement of damage from winter weather
Method name: Amount of winter damage on stem
Method description: Visual survey of winter damage to wood (stems) on scale of 1-10. 1 = all dead, 10 = no damage.
Method reference: Hancock, J.F., Erb, W.A., Goulart, B.L. and Scheerens, J.C. (1997). BLUEBERRY HYBRIDS WITH COMPLEX GENETIC BACKGROUNDS EVALUATED ON MINERAL SOILS: COLD HARDINESS AS INFLUENCED BY PARENTAL SPECIES AND LOCATION. Acta Hortic. 446, 389-396 DOI: 10.17660

Method name: Observation if plant has monopodial growth habit
Method description: Observation if plant has monopodial growth habit

Method description: Visual observation of disease presence of Phomopsis twig blight
